title: How Far Can Blinder See Through the Economic Mist?
sub_head: Here he was a few months ago, cheering on the Biden spending blowout as the vanguard action of the “Biden Boom.”
body:
Prof. Alan S. Blinder is seldom right but never in doubt. Now he states the obvious: Demand is outstripping supply (“Erratic Data Is an Economic Symptom of the Pandemic,” op-ed, June 22). Yet here he was a few months ago, in these pages, cheering on the Biden spending blowout as the vanguard action of the “Biden Boom” (“Welcome to Joe Biden’s Boom Economy,” op-ed, April 22). For a guy who has seen as many pandemics as the rest of us, a little more humility might be in order. It’s not the data, professor. It’s what you’re doing with it.
Conan M. Ward
Princeton, N.J.
